page.title: 03Ecology
page.content: This area provides a varied habitat ranging from the urban/suburban gardens and verges , the Ring Road banks, chalk downlands, mixed woodland and a small stream valley. The flora and fauna are consequently equally as varied. Great emphasis has been put on preserving this rich environment in both the Basingstoke Development Plan and the subsequent Sherborne St. John Village Plan. It is possible to find most of the common British birds and many summer migrants including the cuckoo. Pheasants are reared for local shoot syndicates. The small mammal kingdom includes mice, voles, shrews, rats, rabbits and hares. The larger mammals are represented by foxes, badgers and deer(fallow and roe). The flora includes chalkland regulars and wetland rarities.
